tourist_places.colosseo_desc: The symbol of Rome, one of the largest and most famous Roman amphitheaters in the world.
tourist_places.vaticano_desc: Vatican City, home of the Pope and the Vatican Museums.
tourist_places.fontana_di_trevi_desc: Rome's most famous fountain, known for coin tossing tradition.
tourist_places.basilica_di_san_pietro_desc: The largest basilica in the world, heart of Christianity.
tourist_places.pantheon_desc: Roman temple dedicated to all gods, now a church.
tourist_places.cappella_sistina_desc: Famous for Michelangelo's frescoes, inside the Vatican Museums.
tourist_places.monumento_vittorio_emanuele_ii_desc: Also called Altare della Patria, national monument in Piazza Venezia.
tourist_places.castel_sant_angelo_desc: Ancient mausoleum, later papal fortress, on the banks of the Tiber.
tourist_places.piazza_navona_desc: One of Rome's most beautiful squares, famous for its baroque fountains.
tourist_places.piazza_di_spagna_desc: Famous for the Trinità dei Monti staircase and the Barcaccia Fountain.
tourist_places.foro_romano_desc: The heart of ancient Rome, archaeological area with temples and monumental arches.
